fr.upmc.components.ports

Interface OutboundPortI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, PortI, RequiredI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataOutboundPortI, DataTwoWayPortI, TwoWayPortI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataOutboundPort, AbstractDataTwoWayPort, AbstractOutboundPort, AbstractTwoWayPort, ArrayBlockingQueueConnectionClientOutboundPort, ArrayBlockingQueuePutClientOutboundPort, ArrayBlockingQueueTakeClientOutboundPort, CountDownLatchClientOutboundPort, CountDownLatchConnectionClientOutboundPort, CyclicBarrierClientOutboundPort, CyclicBarrierConnectionClientOutboundPort, DynamicallyConnectableComponentOutboundPort, DynamicComponentCreationOutboundPort, DynamicConnectionRequestOutboundPort, PairedGaugePort, RNGDataOutboundPort, SemaphoreClientOutboundPort, SemaphoreConnectionClientOutboundPort, SensorDataOutboundPort, SensorSimulator.BridgeDataOutboundPort, SynchronizerManagerClientOutboundPort, URIGetterOutboundPort

    public interface OutboundPortI
extends PortI, RequiredI
    The interface OutBoundPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for outgoing calls from a component towards its service providers.

    Description

    An outbound port is a component port through which a client component calls a service provider. It is therefore associated with a required interface that represents the services that are needed by the clients but that it also implements so that its owner component can call its client through the outbound port.

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
